makers.displaydate: 1877–1962; born Berlin, Germany; died Murnau (am Staffelsee), Germany
makers.displaymaker: Gabriele Münter, 1877–1962; born Berlin, Germany; died Murnau (am Staffelsee), Germany

texts.textentryhtml: The fisherman’s house, with boats drawn up on the shore, must have been a familiar sight at Murnau, a town on Lake Staffel where Münter owned a house. The haystacks characterize this as an agricultural region, but Münter’s landscapes in this period are curiously deserted, although always with signs of human habitation. It has been suggested that the lack of people in her compositions reflects the isolated life that Münter, Kandinsky, and their artist friends led in Murnau. Indeed, the New Artists Association Munich was concerned with the promotion of avant-garde expression rather than engagement with social themes.
texts.remarks: K4-6 Rotation March 2014, K 4-6 Rotation January 2016

texts.textentryhtml: (Dalzell Hatfield Galleries, Los Angeles); 1968 purchase by private collection, Princeton, NJ; 2012 gift to Princeton University Art Museum.
